bosk.auto#

Automatic Deep Forest Construction module.

A Deep Forest model can be constructed for different types of data:

  1. Tabular data: ClassicalDeepForestConstructor.

  2. Images or sequences: MGSDeepForestConstructor.

Growing strategies are used to represent stopping criteria. For cross-validation use EarlyStoppingCV, for validation on separately given data set use EarlyStoppingVal.

Metrics used in cross-validation are defined in MetricsEvaluator.

Example:

from bosk.deep_forest import ClassicalDeepForestConstructor, MetricsEvaluator
from bosk.executor import TopologicalExecutor
from bosk.executor.sklearn_interface import BoskPipelineClassifier

constructor = ClassicalDeepForestConstructor(
    TopologicalExecutor,
    rf_params=dict(
        n_estimators=100,
        max_depth=5,
    ),
    layer_width=2,
    max_iter=5,
    cv=3,
    make_metrics=lambda: MetricsEvaluator(['f1']),
    block_classes=(RFCBlock, ETCBlock),
    random_state=12345,
)
pipeline = constructor.construct(X_train, y_train)

model = BoskPipelineClassifier(pipeline, executor_cls=TopologicalExecutor)
model._classifier_init(y_train)  # apply label encoding to be able to predict labels
predicted_labels = model.predict(X_test)

class bosk.auto.BaseAutoDeepForestConstructor(executor_cls, max_iter=10, cv=5, make_metrics=None, growing_strategy=None, block_classes=None, random_state=None)#

Bases: abc.ABC

Base Auto Deep Forest Construction Algorithm.

Sequentially constructs a pipeline using given data set. Construction is splitted into steps, where each step is subdivided into iterations:

  • At different steps the algorithm makes principally different blocks;

  • At different iterations the algorithm generates layers of the same structure.

Parameters:

  • executor_cls (Type[bosk.executor.base.BaseExecutor]) – Executor class (see bosk.executor).

  • max_iter (int) – Maximum number of iterations.

  • cv (Optional[int]) – Number of cross-validation folds. If None the cross-validation is not performed.

  • make_metrics (Optional[Callable[[], bosk.auto.metrics.MetricsEvaluator]]) – Function that makes metrics evaluator.

  • growing_strategy (Optional[bosk.auto.growing_strategies.GrowingStrategy]) – Growing strategy.

  • block_classes (Optional[Tuple[Type[bosk.block.base.BaseBlock], Ellipsis]]) – List of block classes used in layers.

  • random_state (Optional[int]) – Random state.

abstract property n_steps: Optional[int]#

Number of implemented steps.

The steps with number < n_steps will be passed to make_step_layer.

Return type:

Optional[int]

abstract make_step_layer(step, iteration, X, y, validator, rng)#

Make the current step layer.

Parameters:

  • step (int) – Current step number.

  • iteration (int) – Current iteration number.

  • X (numpy.ndarray) – Input features data.

  • y (numpy.ndarray) – Target data.

  • validator (bosk.auto.validation.BasePipelineModelValidator) – Pipeline model validator.

  • rng (numpy.random.Generator) – Random number generator.

Return type:

Optional[bosk.auto.layers.Layer]

construct(X_, y_)#

Construct the pipeline given training data.

Parameters:

  • X_ (numpy.ndarray) – Input features data.

  • y_ (numpy.ndarray) – Target data.

Return type:

bosk.pipeline.base.BasePipeline

class bosk.auto.ClassicalDeepForestConstructor(executor_cls, rf_params=None, layer_width=2, max_iter=10, cv=5, make_metrics=None, growing_strategy=None, block_classes=None, random_state=None)#

Bases: BaseAutoDeepForestConstructor

Classical Deep Forest iteratively builds layers consisting of different Random Forests and Extremely Randomized Trees Classifiers.

Parameters:

  • executor_cls (Type[bosk.executor.base.BaseExecutor]) – Executor class (see bosk.executor).

  • rf_params (Optional[dict]) – Parameters of tree ensembles (Random Forests, Extra Trees).

  • layer_width (int) – Number of blocks of each type in a layer.

  • max_iter (int) – Maximum number of iterations.

  • cv (Optional[int]) – Number of cross-validation folds. If None the cross-validation is not performed.

  • make_metrics (Optional[Callable[[], bosk.auto.metrics.MetricsEvaluator]]) – Function that makes metrics evaluator.

  • growing_strategy (Optional[bosk.auto.growing_strategies.GrowingStrategy]) – Growing strategy.

  • block_classes (Optional[Tuple[Type[bosk.block.base.BaseBlock], Ellipsis]]) – List of block classes used in layers.

  • random_state (Optional[int]) – Random state.

rf_params#

Parameters of tree ensembles (Random Forests, Extra Trees).

LAYER_CLS#
n_steps = 1#

Number of steps. The Classical Deep Forest has just one step.

  • y (numpy.ndarray) – Target data.

  • validator (bosk.auto.validation.BasePipelineModelValidator) – Pipeline model validator.

  • rng (numpy.random.Generator) – Random number generator.

class bosk.auto.MGSDeepForestConstructor(executor_cls, input_shape, rf_params=None, conv_params=None, layer_width=2, max_iter=10, cv=5, make_metrics=None, growing_strategy=None, block_classes=None, random_state=None)#

Bases: BaseAutoDeepForestConstructor

Classical Multi-Grained Scanning Deep Forest.

It consists of convolutional layers which reduce spatial dimensions (step 1), and classical stacking-based layers (step 2).

Parameters:

  • executor_cls (Type[bosk.executor.base.BaseExecutor]) – Executor class (see bosk.executor).

  • input_shape (Tuple[int]) – Input shape (spatial dimensions).

  • rf_params (Optional[dict]) – Parameters of tree ensembles (Random Forests, Extra Trees).

  • conv_params (Optional[dict]) – Parameters of MGS layers.

  • layer_width (int) – Number of blocks of each type in a layer.

  • max_iter (int) – Maximum number of iterations.

  • cv (Optional[int]) – Number of cross-validation folds. If None the cross-validation is not performed.

  • make_metrics (Optional[Callable[[], bosk.auto.metrics.MetricsEvaluator]]) – Function that makes metrics evaluator.

  • growing_strategy (Optional[bosk.auto.growing_strategies.GrowingStrategy]) – Growing strategy.

  • block_classes (Optional[Tuple[Type[bosk.block.base.BaseBlock], Ellipsis]]) – List of block classes used in layers.

  • random_state (Optional[int]) – Random state.

rf_params#

Parameters of tree ensembles (Random Forests, Extra Trees).

STACKING_LAYER_CLS#
MGS_LAYER_CLS#
n_steps = 2#

Number of steps. The Classical Deep Forest has two steps.

class bosk.auto.EarlyStoppingCV(mode='all', patience=1)#

Bases: GrowingStrategy

Early stopping based on cross-validation metrics.

Parameters:

  • mode (Union[Literal[any], Literal[all]]) – Stop when any of the metrics is worse than the best metric or **all* of the metrics are worse than the best metric.

  • patience (int) – Number of epochs to wait before stopping.

need_grow(pipeline, metrics, executor_cls, growing_state)#

Check if the pipeline needs to be grown further.

Parameters:

  • pipeline – The most recent pipeline to check.

  • metrics – Metrics evaluation results.

  • executor_cls – Executor class to use.

  • growing_state (dict) – Growing state that stores a context of the strategy.

Returns:

True if the pipeline needs to be grown further.

Return type:

bool

trim(pipelines, growing_state)#

Trim the last count pipelines.

Parameters:

  • pipelines (List[bosk.pipeline.base.BasePipeline]) –

  • growing_state (dict) –

class bosk.auto.EarlyStoppingVal(data, make_metrics_eval, **early_stopping_params)#

Bases: EarlyStoppingCV

Early stopping based on validation metrics.

Parameters:

  • data (Mapping[str, bosk.data.BaseData]) – Data for validation.

  • make_metrics_eval (Callable[[], bosk.auto.metrics.MetricsEvaluator]) – Function that returns a new MetricsEvaluator.

  • mode – Stop when any of the metrics is worse than the best metric or **all* of the metrics are worse than the best metric.

  • patience – Number of epochs to wait before stopping.

class bosk.auto.MetricsEvaluator(names)#

Calculates, collects and aggregates the specified metrics.

Any metric follows the rule “the higher is better”, i.e. if originally metric decreases when quality increases, it is multiplied by (-1).

Parameters:

names (List[str]) – A list of metric names to be evaluated.

names :set[str]#

A list of metric names to be evaluated.

results :collections.defaultdict[str, List[float]]#

A mapping (dictionary) of metric names to lists of metric values.

append_eval(y_true, y_pred)#

Evaluate and append the evaluation results.

Parameters:

  • y_true (numpy.ndarray) – Ground truth values.

  • y_pred (numpy.ndarray) – Predicted values.

average()#

Averages the evaluation results.

Returns:

A mapping (dictionary) of metric names to average metric values.

Return type:

MetricsResults
